page.title: 06Arts and Crafts
page.content: The longest mural in Europe is situated in Nechells.It was undertaken by a group of Birmingham artists and the design reflects the life and events of the Nechells area.Local schools submitted designs to be included in the mural.Examples of the scenes depicted include local heroes,The Battle of Birmingham,The Barracks,Birmingham Public Transport and pre-redevelopment street scenes.The mural spans the Rupert Street Wall of the Windsor Industrial Estate,measuring 301 metres in length.Each part of the mural is an inset of the wall (approx.3m x 3m).The Manpower Services Commission funded the project which was completed in 1984. In an area known for it's vandalism and graffiti,the mural has existed completely without blemish for sixteen months.
